author: barnabemonnot
content: hi! I was lurking in this channel for a few days but didn't have anything too concrete to present. I am working on a simulation environment for EIP 1559, I have some code and a notebook (also serves for me to explain how this works). It's too long while some parts are underdeveloped but if you want to see how it's shaping up feel free to take a look here: https://github.com/ethereum/rig/blob/master/eip1559/eip1559.ipynb

author: barnabemonnot
content: my endgoal with this is indeed to run behavioural simulations. i am also trying to get past transactions data so that I can start modelling the demand somewhat realistically. it probably won't be as refined as what you would get from running the mechanism but it will certainly be better than assuming a uniformly distributed (or plug in your favourite probability distribution here) gas price

author: barnabemonnot
content: eventually i'd like to be able to write more things more formally too, in terms of agent strategies and payoffs. but i think as a first step the simulations will help clarify a few things

author: barnabemonnot
content: <@!118185622543269890> it sounds like you also want to do something similar though with a different approach, if you want to catch up I would be happy to help/contribute

author: barnabemonnot
content: so far i didn't consider plugging in any client into the simulation but ultimately this would be the best, also to make sure that we are simulating the code that will be in production and not our approximation of it (this is what i am focused on with the beacon runner too: https://github.com/ethereum/rig/blob/master/eth2economics/code/beaconrunner/beacon_runner.ipynb)

author: barnabemonnot
content: would love to have your comments! still catching up on a few resources about EIP 1559 that some of you were involved in ðŸ™‚

content: This looks fantastic! Much more thorough than what I was intending on doing haha

author: barnabemonnot
content: hi! i spoke with Tanner and Tom though was under the impression they were more focused on eth2. for eth2 i believe there will be opportunities to sync when it comes to simulating/modelling stuff, probably for eip 1559 too
